content: The goal says the file contains 2 keys, result and vars. The first test case "Very simple" only has 1 key, not vars -- the goal text should say that vars is optional?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting parsing puzzle. Clear statement and adapted tests. The difficulty rating might be arguable but it's not unreasonable.

Well since it has almost reached the deadline I'm going to approve it before I forget.

I would have liked to hear to opinion of the seasoned people of the site about the difficulty but I reckon that after all it's not a big deal if it ends up in one over the other. 

Thanks for the puzzle!

The puzzle is great and the tests are relevant, my only caveat is the difficulty. Of course this is a personal opinion, but I'd be willing to argue that this one is harder than the cgx-formatter (labelled hard), which doesn't even include evaluations.

At any rate, I'll eventually approve it before the reset but I'd like to hear other people's opinions first. 

Also typo: any arrangements is possible -> are possible / or / every arrangement is possible

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good puzzle to work on parsing & recursion.
The statement is clear & difficulty level is adequate.

I have just worked on a puzzle that also deals with numbers above 2^63 (https://www.codingame.com/training/medium/christmas-tree) and based on the forum and the comments on the contribution, is seems that most people think that having to manage numbers that big is adding nothing to the quality of the puzzle, on the contrary it is seen as an unnecessary burden.
I think it would be better to only use numbers in the range -2^63 - 2^63, only the last test would be affected and it doesn't impact the puzzle.

Goal section
* Please change "will contains" to "contains" (2 times).

* Suggest to change "with the final value of the calculations to be" to "whose final value should be calculated and".

* Please change "i.e." to "e.g." (5 times).

* Suggest to change the last example to illustrate the simplification of fractions, e.g. 5/9+7/9=4/3.

Input section
* Please format the line numbers in <<bold>>.

* Please move "Each line contains maximum 2000 characters. All the characters are ASCII." to Constraints section.

Constraints
* Does a variable of type "str" carry a value of EITHER a variable name OR one of the operators only, and no other possible values (including space characters)? If so, please state so.

* Does 'result' always resolve to be a number (and never a string)? If so, please state so.

* Please state the constraint on N.

Cases
* Currently N is always 1. Are you planning to add cases where N > 1?

* As you mentioned in your comment, you will revise the cases. So, it is expected that there will be more cases, and no duplicate cases afterwards.

Thanks.
I will add new tests and fix the validators if there is interest in this proposal. Thanks for your feedback!

Hi, 
Thanks for your support!
I updated the constrains section to include large numbers and changed the name of the test. Do you think I should limit the big numbers to avoid "python-only" solutions? 
I also added the two tests you suggested with their validators.
Is there a way to reorder the tests without re-entering them?
I agree with you. I fixed the last test/validator and modified the constrains. Hope it is ok. Thanks!

Thanks, I fixed the typo (I'm learning english as well as coding :-) ). 
I agree with the difficulty level but I wait the opinions of others.
Np, I'm learning Italian as well as coding too :P

There are other puzzle that deal with very big numbers but it definitely makes this puzzle harder if your language doesn't directly support unlimited numbers like Python does.

I don't think you can re-order the tests, it's a feature that's currently missing.

One last thing I would change would be to specify that when the expression is a block with an operator, the order of the info is not guaranteed.
Maybe below "is the value of the variable v2 plus the value of the expression." you could add:
The order ('num1';'num2';'operator') is not guaranteed, any arrangements is possible, ex: ('num1';'operator';'num2'), ...
